zone.line: Is it not strange that grief
should quickly follow so divine a
happiness? I drank of an enchanted
cup but gall was at the bottom of
its long drawn sweetness. My heart
was full of deep affection, but it
was calm from its very depth and
fulness. I cou had no idea that misery
could arise from love, and this lesson
that all at last ^must learn was taught
me in a manner few are obliged
to receive it. I lament now, I must
ever lament, those few short months
of Paradisaical bliss; I disobeyed no
command, I ate no apple, and yet I
was ruthlessly driven from it. Alas!
my companion did, and I was preci
-pitated in his fall. But I return
wander from my relation â€“ let woe
come at its appointed time; I may
^ stage of my story still talk of happiness.
